page.title: 15Goudhurst Women's Institute.
page.content: The W.I. meet on the third Wednesday each mointh in Village Hall. It was formed in November 1920 and now has 44 members. They have 2 members on the District Committee, the Secretary and the Representative for Education and Public Affairs. This job consists of organising outings and meetings, and keeping the institute in touch with county organisers. Goudhurst T.I. played their part in the recent Festivalby organising a Village Quiz with four teams - the Young Wives, Church, British Legion and themselves. Wine and cheese was served later.During the year they have had speakers on such subjects as palmistry, the experiences of a driving examiner,English windmills and slides of unusual parts of Tunbridge Wells. They have had outings to Maidstone theatre, and Lamberhurst Vinyards followed by ploughmans supper.
